content: 2023 film by Nicole Midori Woodford ***Last Shadow at First Light*** is a 2023 internationally co-produced [supernatural](/wiki/Supernatural_film) [drama film](/wiki/Drama_film) written and directed by Singaporean director [Nicole Midori Woodford](/wiki/Nicole_Midori_Woodford) in her feature-length debut. It premiered at the [71st San Sebastián International Film Festival](/wiki/71st_San_Sebasti%C3%A1n_International_Film_Festival) in September 2023, where it was in competition for the Kutxabank-New Directors Award. ## Cast - [Masatoshi Nagase](/wiki/Masatoshi_Nagase) as Ami's uncle - Mihaya Shirata as Ami - [Mariko Tsutsui](/wiki/Mariko_Tsutsui) as Ami's mother - [Peter Yu](/wiki/Peter_Yu) as Ami's father - Yong Ser Pin as Ami's grandfather ## Production The film won the SEAFIC Lab's SEA Open Fund and [TorinoFilmLab](/wiki/TorinoFilmLab) Feature Lab's TFL Coproduction Award. It was also developed at the [Singapore International Film Festival](/wiki/Singapore_International_Film_Festival)'s SEA Lab and Talents Tokyo. It received support from the [Singapore Film Commission](/wiki/Singapore_Film_Commission), Slovenian Film Centre, Purin Pictures and Talents Tokyo Next Masters Support Program, among others. Most of the filming took place in and around [Rikuzentakata](/wiki/Rikuzentakata,_Iwate) in [Japan](/wiki/Japan), a city which was largely devastated by the [2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami](/wiki/2011_T%C5%8Dhoku_earthquake_and_tsunami). The film was also shot in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). - *Last Shadow at First Light* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Last Shadow at First Light
